description.narrative: Project Title is "Thriving Resilience through Empowering Community Project". Project aims to provide target communities with improved knowledge on human rights and democratization processes, holding equal rights and to gain equity among people while empowering them to plan and implement the community development activities through the functioning of revolving fund. Problem Analysis- The local people targeted as beneficiaries have been silent and quiet for many years as they are not aware for their basic rights, reluctant to claim and to raise voices for equality from imbalances. In addition, there is no facilitator to assist them or agencies to edify them in order to deal with challenges and problems caused as well as for the behavioural change in terms of right based issues and cases. Objectives- 1) Increased income of target community, 2)  Local CBOs (i.e. VDC,SHG) are able to  Lead and manage their community activities, 3) Local community able to claim or solve their right issues  and (4) Improved capacities of local partners’ (Associations) are defined to achieve the program goal. Expected result of project outputs among right holders are going to maintain using gained knowledge, capacities and understanding on their rights to claim conditions and positions at each level. In addition, follow-up activities, lessons learned, regular field visits by project personnel after project period and apparent success and achievement in both civic atmosphere and women's lives would escalate to keep the working spirit up for sustainability. Main activities are building knowledge on basic human rights, sharing civic education, implanting peace building concepts through capacity building, and promoting gender equality through empowering women in their social and economic prospects while enlightening women rights and advocacy measures in target communities are primary concern of this project. Main thematic areas are Human Rights and Social and Economic Justice.
This project mainly contributes to results within Economic empowerment of women. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020
